content.description: A student placed 20 tobacco seeds of the same species on moist paper towels in each of two petri dishes. Dish A was wrapped completely in an opaque cover to exclude all light. Dish B was not wrapped. The dishes were placed equidistant from a light source set to a cycle of 14 hours of light and 10 hours of dark. All other conditions were the same for both dishes. The dishes were examined after 7 days and the opaque cover was permanently removed from dish A. Both dishes were returned to the light and examined again at 14 days. The following data were obtained.
content.question: Additional observations were made on day 21, and no yellow-leaved seedlings were found alive in either dish. This is most likely because

choices.label: yellow-leaved seedlings were unable to absorb water from the paper towels
taller green-leaved seedlings blocked the light and prevented photosynthesis
yellow-leaved seedlings were unable to convert light energy to chemical energy
a higher rate of respiration in yellow-leaved seedlings depleted their stored nutrients

content.answer: yellow-leaved seedlings were unable to convert light energy to chemical energy
